review: As a media streaming device, I like it. As an Android game console, my kids like it. A good 1st effort but it's lacking in several areas that need to be addressed in order to become excellent:- Menu navigation is good at best.  I do like the voice search.- 8GB storage is soon depleted. Need the ability to add storage.- USB port is not utilized. Really need this for added storage.- Clash of Clans has to be included in the game selection in order to be competitive. Kids love the super-size Minecraft.  These two games alone would make this worthwhile.- Cost of the Game Controller is high considering the quality of the competition like PS4, X-Box and Wii U.  Amazon should include a $25.00 any game coupon to sweeten the deal.Overall, I am pleased and have ordered the Fire TV Stick to expand the experience.  I look forward to the much needed enhancements.

review: Bought this to replace my WDTV Live. I knew the the FireTV doesn't natively stream local content out of the box, but I also knew that I could side-load XBMC to get that functionality. And via XBMC it streams music and movie files very well. This device is FAST, much faster than the WDTV, the responsiveness between the two devices is like night and day. The native on-board apps are fine also. Some could use some more attention (Hulu, Netflix) but definitely no show-stoppers that I've seen so far.Why this is a 4-star review instead of a 5-star:- CODEC support: movies that have DTS-HD dumb down to just DTS. The higher end Dolby audo streams convert to regular stereo. I understand why that is (it's a licensing thing) and I hope it's something Amazon will address in the future.- stuck at 60fps output: and that's fine for games, but for movies, not so much. Without getting too technical, taking a source recorded at 29.97i (DVD) or 23.976p (Blu-Ray) and outputting that at 60p forces 3:2 pulldown - that's extra work for your TV/receiver and depending on the quality of your system, you'll see blurs/tearing in the video.- no native local media streaming capability: if it weren't for XBMC, I wouldn't have bought the FireTV.

review: Removing my previous review due to software updates since I've purchased the device:First I want to say that I pre-ordered this device and absolutely loved it until recently.Amazon did a software update and it completely broke the Hulu app.> The app icon (for Hulu) no longer displays (not a huge deal, but annoying)> The picture goes out while trying to stream content (black picture - only sound plays)I've done some troubleshooting to verify the issue is with the device:> I've tried streaming through my DVD player, Apple TV, and Roku 2, PC, Gaming Console(s) - all play without issue> Plug the Amazon Fire back in and I can't watch one episode without disruptionI have 2 other friends that purchased the Fire TV and Fire Stick based off my recommendation, they are having the same issues. The issue is not internet related. I've run speed tests, checked servers for packet loss, etc. The Prime content is nice - and definitely getting better, but I use this thing for Plex, Hulu, and Netflix primarily. Since it fails at Hulu, I am going back to a Roku today.Amazon, please resolve the issues with Hulu.
